intro: Brachytome russellii, commonly known as Russell's brachytome, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
